title: Kenyans on X Raise KSh 2m in Hours to Support Families of 2 Protesters Killed during Demos - Tuko.co.ke
text: Kenyans on X Raise KSh 2m in Hours to Support Families of 2 Protesters Killed during Demos - Rex Masai was reportedly shot by an undercover police officer on Thursday, June 20, during protests against the Finance Bill 2024 - Evans Kiratu was allegedly hit by a teargas canister on his groin before being rushed to Kenyatta National Hospital, where he passed away - Kenyans on X collaborated and raised more than KSh 2 million for the families of Masai and Kiratu to ensure they could provide them with a decent farewell PAY ATTENTION: Flexible Payment Plans Available! [Invest in Yourself & See the Return with Our Affordable Copywriting Course!](https://corp.tuko.co.ke/courses/copywriting?utm_source=site&utm_medium=article&utm_campaign=%D1%81opywriting_%D1%81ourse_4&utm_id=Copywriting+Course) Kenyans on X (formerly Twitter) have raised more than KSh 2 million to support the families of Rex Masai and Evans Kiratu, who lost their lives during [demonstrations against the Finance Bill 2024.](https://www.tuko.co.ke/politics/552616-maandamano-kenyans-protest-finance-bill-voting-today/) How did Kenyans raise KSh 2 million? Kenyans on X social media platform came together in order to make contributions to ensure that Masai and Kiratu will be given a decent burial. The fundraiser, spearheaded by Kimuzi in partnership with Osama Otero and Hanifa Adan, witnessed numerous Kenyans contributing as a final tribute to the deceased men. "Our brothers Rex & Evans | M-CHANGA. Here is the link. I will transfer all the funds from my Mpesa that were contributed. The target is 2 million. Let's achieve this goal together for both families," Kimuzi posted. Without delay, Kenyans started sending their contributions along with screenshots of their transactions to encourage others to contribute. Eight hours later, Kimuzi updated Kenyans on the fundraiser's advancement, proudly stating that the goal had been exceeded by hundreds of thousands of shillings. "8 hours later, we are at 2M. This week, am happy, for the first time as a Kenyan. You can kill a liberator, but will never kill the incoming lib√©ration!" he tweeted. He also expressed gratitude to Kenyans who contributed in support of the two individuals who passed away during the Anti-Finance Bill protests. How did Rex Masai and Evans Kiratu die? Rex Masai was reportedly shot by an undercover law enforcement officer on Thursday, June 20, during protests near Parliament. His rescuers put up makeshift structures to [ attend to him before he was rushed to the Bliss Medical Centre,](https://www.tuko.co.ke/kenya/552731-nairobi-anti-finance-bill-protester-shot-dead-thursday-demos/) where he was confirmed dead. Emmanuel Kimang'a, a doctor at Bliss, stated that Rex likely died from blood loss after being shot in the upper thigh. On the other hand, Evans Kiratu [succumbed to the injuries he sustained ](https://www.tuko.co.ke/kenya/552779-nairobi-second-protester-dies-hospital-groin-injury/)during the Thursday protests in [Nairobi](https://kiswahili.tuko.co.ke/tags/habari-za-kaunti-ya-nairobi/). Police struck the 21-year-old with a tear gas canister, injuring him in the groin area while he was on the streets protesting against the Finance Bill 2024. He was transported to Kenyatta Hospital, where he later died from his injuries. What else you need to know about Masai and Kiratu deaths - Embakasi East MP Babu Owino [pledged financial support](https://www.tuko.co.ke/kenya/552795-rex-masai-babu-owino-donates-ksh-200k-funeral-arrangement-protester-shot-dead/)to the late Rex Masai's family toward his burial. - A CCTV footage [showing how a plain clothed police officer shot Masai](https://www.tuko.co.ke/kenya/552739-rex-masai-cctv-footage-showing-moment-slain-protester-shot-dead-emerges/)during Finance Bill 2024 protests emerged - A video doing rounds online [showed the moment a young Kenyan protester Evans Kiratu](https://www.tuko.co.ke/kenya/counties/552785-video-protester-falling-allegedly-struck-groin-emerges/)was allegedly struck by police. Source: TUKO.co.ke
